pr_title: DB-10177 Make SHOW INDEXES support index expressions

timeline.message: DB-10177 Make SHOW INDEXES support index expressions

timeline.author: martinrupp

replies.bodyText: Done, changed the version number to 3.2.0.1985.
replies.author: ascend1

timeline.bodyText: why 2048? should be a constant in my opinion
timeline.author: martinrupp

replies.bodyText:
No particular reason for this, just that SQL Server has this table (similar purpose but not exactly the same ofc) with 2048 values.
Since I move the loop to row factory, I make a new constant in row factory class.
replies.author: ascend1

timeline.author: martinrupp

timeline.bodyText: shouldn't we maybe put this in SYSNATURALNUMBERSRowFactory.java? Otherwise SpliceDataDictionary one day will be 20'000 lines long, basically taking care of "everything".
timeline.author: martinrupp

replies.bodyText: Good point! I move the main logic to the row factory. However, is wrapper has to be in SpliceDataDictionary because we need to get the TabInfoImpl from data dictionary'snonCoreTI.
replies.author: ascend1

timeline.bodyText: This is a base table row, not an index row,  should we use getValueRow() instead?
